title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 218-1.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 218-1.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following definitions govern the provisions of this

Part: (a) Add-on part means any
aftermarket part which is not a modified part or a replacement part. (b) Aftermarket part means any part of an air
contaminant emission control system sold for installation on a vehicle after
the original retail sale of the vehicle. (c) Air contaminant emission control system
means equipment designed for installation on a motor vehicle or motor vehicle
engine for the purpose of reducing the air contaminants emitted from the motor
vehicle or motor vehicle engine, or a system or engine modification on a motor
vehicle or motor vehicle engine which causes a reduction of air contaminants
emitted from the motor vehicle or motor vehicle engine, including but not
limited to exhaust control systems, fuel evaporation control systems and
crankcase ventilating systems. (d) ATPZEV means advanced technology partial ZEV as defined in California Code of

Regulations, title 13, section
1962
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (e) BEV means battery electric vehicle as
defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1962
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (f) California standards means those
standards for motor vehicles and motor vehicle engines that the State of

California has adopted and is permitted to adopt under
42 USC
7543
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title) and that other
states are permitted to adopt under
42 USC
7507
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (g) CARB means the California State Air

Resources Board as defined in California's Health and Safety Code, section
39003 (2004) (see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (h) Certification means a finding by the

California Air Resources Board that a motor vehicle, motor vehicle engine, or
air contaminant emission control system has satisfied the criteria adopted by
CARB for the control of specified air contaminants from motor
vehicles. (i) Certified device means
an air contaminant emission control system for which a certification has been
issued by CARB or the department. (j) Consolidated part means a consolidated
part as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see

Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (k) Diesel-cycle means powered by an engine
where the primary means of controlling power output is by limiting the amount
of fuel that is injected into the combustion chambers of the engine. (l) Electric drive system means an electric
propulsion system as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1962
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (m) Emergency vehicle means a vehicle as
defined in section 165 of the California Vehicle Code (see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (n) Emissions-related part means any
automotive part which affects any regulated emissions from a motor vehicle or
motor vehicle engine which is subject to California or Federal emissions
standards, as set forth in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900 (see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (o) Emission standards means specified
limitations on the discharge of air contaminants into the atmosphere. (p) Engine family means the basic
classification unit of a manufacturer's product line used for the purpose of
test fleet selection. (q) Enhanced
ATPZEV means an enhanced advanced technology partial ZEV as defined in

California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1962.1
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (r) Established place of business, as used in
this Part, means a place actually occupied either continuously or at regular
periods for business use. (s) FCV
means fuel cell vehicle. (t) Fuel
evaporative loss emissions means vaporized fuel emitted into the atmosphere
from the fuel system of a motor vehicle. (u) Fuel system means the combination of fuel
tank(s), fuel lines and carburetor, or fuel injector, and includes all vents
and fuel evaporative emission control systems or devices. (v) Heavy-duty engine means an engine which
is used to propel a heavy-duty vehicle. (w) Heavy-duty vehicle means heavy-duty
vehicle as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (x) HEV means hybrid electric
vehicle. (y) Intermediate volume
manufacturer means intermediate volume manufacturer as defined in California

Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (z) Large volume manufacturer means large
volume manufacturer as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (aa)
LEV means a low-emission
vehicle. (ab)

Light-duty truck means
light-duty truck as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (ac)

Medium-duty vehicle means medium-duty
vehicle as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (ad)

Military tactical vehicles and equipment
means military tactical vehicles and equipment as defined by California Code of

Regulations, title 13, section
1905
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (ae)

Model-year means the manufacturer's
annual production period for each engine family which includes January 1st of
such calendar year or, if the manufacturer has no annual production period, the
calendar year. In the case of any motor vehicle manufactured in two or more
stages, the time of manufacture shall be the date of completion of the
chassis. (af)

Modified part means
modified part as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900 (see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (ag)

Motor vehicle is a vehicle which is
self-propelled. (ah)

New motor
vehicle means a motor vehicle, the equitable or legal title to which has never
been transferred to the ultimate purchaser. (ai)

New motor vehicle engine means a new
engine in a motor vehicle. (aj)
NEV
means neighborhood electric vehicle as defined in as defined in California Code
of Regulations, title 13, section
1962
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (ak)

Offset vehicle means a vehicle that has
been certified by the State of California as set forth in the California Code
of Regulations, title 13, section
1960.5
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (al)

Passenger car means any motor vehicle
designed with a capability for transportation of persons and having a design
capacity of 12 persons or less. (am)

Quarterly reporting means reporting based upon the following calendar periods: January 1-March 31, April 1-June 30, July 1-September 30, October 1- December
31. (an)

Replacement part means any
aftermarket part which is intended to replace an original equipment
emissions-related part and which is functionally identical to the original
equipment part in all respects which in any way affect emissions (including
durability), or a consolidated part. (ao)

Sale means the transfer of title to a
motor vehicle or motor vehicle engine to the ultimate or subsequent
purchaser. (ap)

Small volume
manufacturer means small volume manufacturer as defined in California Code of

Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (aq)

Recall means recall as defined in

California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (ar)

Subgroup means a set of motor vehicles
within an engine family distinguishable by characteristics contained in the
manufacturer's application for certification of the California
standards. (as)
SULEV means a
super-ultra-low-emission vehicle. (at)

Test group means a grouping of vehicles
as defined by 40 CFR section
86.1827-01
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (au)
TLEV means a transitional-low-emission
vehicle. (av)
ULEV means an
ultra-low-emission vehicle. (aw)

Ultimate purchaser means, with respect to any new motor vehicle or new motor
vehicle engine, the first person who in good faith purchases a new motor
vehicle or new motor vehicle engine for purposes other than resale. (ax)

Used motor vehicle means any motor
vehicle which is not a new motor vehicle. (ay)
TZEV means a transitional-zero-emission
vehicle. (az)

Useful life means a
period of use to be determined by the department consistent with the
requirements of the California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2112
(see

Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (ba)

Vehicle means a device by which any
person or property may be propelled, moved, or drawn upon a highway, excepting
a device moved exclusively by human power or used exclusively upon stationary
rails or tracks. (bb)
ZEV means a
zero-emission-vehicle. (bc)
PZEV
means partial ZEV as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1962
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (bd)

Independent low volume manufacturer
means independent low volume manufacturer as defined in California Code of

Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table 1, section
200.9
of this Title). (be)

Warrantable condition means a
warrantable condition as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2035
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (bf)

Warrantable part means a warrantable
part as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2035
(see

Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (bg)

Warranty period means warranty period as
defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2035
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (bh)

Warranty station means a warranty
station as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
2035
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (bi)

Medium-duty passenger vehicle means
medium-duty passenger vehicle as defined in California Code of Regulations, title 13, section
1900
(see Table I, section
200.9
of this Title). (bj)

Bus line means bus line as defined in

New York Consolidated Laws, Chapter 61-A, Article 1 § 2. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
218-1.2

Amended

New

York State Register July 26, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 30, eff. 7/6/2023, exp. 9/3/2023
(Emergency)

Amended

New

York State Register August 23, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 34, eff. 9/4/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
